meanings.definition: A protein found in silk produced by spiders and silkworms.
meanings.sent1: The fibroin in the silk gives it strength and durability.
meanings.sent2: Silkworms produce fibroin to create their silk cocoons.
meanings.sent3: The spiders had a party, and the fibroin in their silk made the decorations extra strong!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like fibroin, holding her together even in the toughest times.
meanings.sent5: The fibroin in the silk shimmered in the sunlight, a testament to its quality.

meanings.definition: The main component of silk fibers.
meanings.sent1: The fibroin gives silk its smooth texture and lustrous appearance.
meanings.sent2: When examining silk fibers under a microscope, one can see the fibroin structure.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer accidentally spilled coffee on the fibroin, creating a unique pattern on the silk dress.
meanings.sent4: Her words were woven with fibroin threads of sincerity, making them truly heartfelt.
meanings.sent5: As she ran her fingers over the silk, she could feel the fibroin strands that held it all together.
